qas.question: Who suggested that Jesus was the son of a Roman soldier?
What was the name of the Roman soldier said by Celsus to be the father of Jesus?
Origen was a Church Father in which Egyptian city?
In which century did Celsus suggest that Jesus' father was a Roman soldier?
For what purpose did detractors use the idea of Mary's virginity and the virgin conception of Jesus?

answers.text: to challenge the divinity of Jesus

qas.question: Who suggested that Panthera was the illegitimate son Jesus?
What century did Panthera become a Roman Soldier?
In what Egyptian city did Origen visit his Church Father?
In what Egyptian city did Jesus find the Roman soldier?
Who was Celsus an illegitimate son of?

context: From the early stages of Christianity, belief in the virginity of Mary and the virgin conception of Jesus, as stated in the gospels, holy and supernatural, was used by detractors, both political and religious, as a topic for discussions, debates and writings, specifically aimed <a4_0>to challenge the divinity of Jesus<a4_0/> and thus Christians and Christianity alike. In the <a3_0><b6_0>2nd<b6_0/><a3_0/> century, as part of the earliest anti-Christian polemics, <a0_0><b5_0>Celsus<b5_0/><a0_0/> suggested that Jesus was the illegitimate son of <b9_0>a Roman soldier<b9_0/> named <a1_0>Panthera<a1_0/>. The views of Celsus drew responses from Origen, the Church Father in <a2_0><b7_0><b8_0>Alexandria<b8_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/>, Egypt, who considered it a fabricated story. How far Celsus sourced his view from Jewish sources remains a subject of discussion.
